alert.note: Alert for Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:29AM EST until January 04 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR STEPHENS COUNTY... At 829 AM EST, It was reported that Toccoa Creek was flooding a portion of Falls Road this morning. Additional areas of high water were also likely in other areas of Greater Toccoa after a 3.5 inch rainfall event. With little to no chance of additional heavy rain expected, high water conditions and flooding of low-lying areas will gradually improve as the morning wears on. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Toccoa, Martin, Avalon, Lake Hartwell, Eastanolee and Boydville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
